data.name: The Overlap Time
data.description:
Given an hour h on the 12-hour clock and the number of minute divisions n, return the time (in hour and minutes) at which the hour and minute hands overlap or make the smallest angle.

NOTE:

1. The findOverlapTime(h,n) function takes two integers as an input: The first one, h, represents the hour ranging from [1-12]. The second input n is the number of minute divisions and it should satisfy the following condition:
(60/n)==integer; otherwise the follownig error should be thrown:

"n did not pass the test!"
WHAT DO YOU MEAN BY MINUTE DIVISION???!!!!!
the regular clock has 60 divisoins for the minute hand which means there are 60 numbers from 0 to 59 that you can use to tell the minute! However, If n=20, there will be 20 numbers around the clock from 0 to 57 (multiples of 3)that you can use to report the minute(i.e. 01:03, 06:42, 11:57).

2. The clock's hands jump in discreet steps. The smallest steps for the minute and hour hands are equal to the angle that each hand sweeps in 60/n minutes.

3. The returned time is a string in the following format: "hh:mm". The hour ranges from [1-12], and minute should be an integer in the range of [0-59].

4. For the specific case when h=12, you may need to convert 12 to 0 in order to get the right answer. The results should still be in the correct format.

5. The hour part of the returned time (i.e. "hh" in "hh:mm") should always be the same as the input hour.
